article.title: Local Density of the Bose Glass Phase

choices: The effect of system size on the critical disorder strength.
The linear relationship between superfluid density and disorder strength.
The scaling behavior of the superfluid density near the superfluid-Bose glass transition.
The absence of a phase transition in the studied parameter range.

multiple_choice_question.text: What key characteristic of the local density distribution is evident in Figure 2 as disorder strength increases?
choices: The distribution develops a pronounced peak at a local density of 2.
The distribution becomes increasingly skewed with a long tail towards higher local densities.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 3 shows the skewness, kurtosis, and mode of the local density distribution as functions of disorder strength. What does the behavior of the mode suggest about the local density distribution at high disorder?
choices: The most frequent local density shifts towards 1.
The most frequent local density shifts towards 0.
The most frequent local density remains constant at 1.1.
The mode cannot be reliably determined at high disorder.

multiple_choice_question.text: The mass exponent, τ(q), is introduced in Formula (4). What does a non-linear dependence of τ(q) on q indicate about the local density distribution?
